NEET_Biology_Teacher_Note: Hello future doctor! I have compiled the most relevant questions from the past decade focusing on 'Body Fluids and Circulation'. Pay close attention to ECG waves and the Cardiac Cycle, as these are high-yield topics.

Options.d: Closure of the tricuspid and bicuspid valves

Student_Tips_on_Circulatory_Motion.Tip_1: Master the ECG Waves: Always remember P = Atrial depolarization, QRS = Ventricular depolarization (systole starts), and T = Ventricular repolarization.
Student_Tips_on_Circulatory_Motion.Tip_2: Calculate Cardiac Output: Use the formula: Cardiac Output = Stroke Volume × Heart Rate. In a healthy adult, this is roughly 5 liters/minute.
Student_Tips_on_Circulatory_Motion.Tip_3: Valve Logic: Heart sounds are created by the CLOSURE of valves, not the opening. Lub = AV valves closure; Dub = Semilunar valves closure.
Student_Tips_on_Circulatory_Motion.Tip_4: Blood Grouping: O− is the universal donor (no antigens), and AB+ is the universal recipient (no antibodies).
Student_Tips_on_Circulatory_Motion.Tip_5: Pathways: Remember the flow of the conducting system: SA Node → AV Node → Bundle of His → Purkinje Fibers.
